review_preview: Despite a recommendation by our hotel concierge, and the great recent reviews on Trip Adviser, we had a very average luncheon at this venue.Of our 8 day stay in Madrid , and enjoying excellent food, we were disappointed with Garcia de la Navarra.To...
review_full: Despite a recommendation by our hotel concierge, and the great recent reviews on Trip Adviser, we had a very average luncheon at this venue. Of our 8 day stay in Madrid , and enjoying excellent food, we were disappointed with Garcia de la Navarra. To be fair however, without knowing what was going on, we did notice other later customers , and possibly regulars, being turned away, which indicated to us that something maybe wrong? This venue seemed to be very popular in their bar, and especially by well dressed "suits" clientele. The street location of the restaurant is very pleasant but where we were inside was nothing special. Upon arrival we were seated on the high stools and table, in the front bar on one of three "reserved" tables, and not in the back restaurant area. It was very noisy and the table was small and not linen covered. The menu for lunch in our opinion is basic but had some interesting items like their stews. The wine list is HUGE , but not clearly labelled, and the pages are tied together, so you need a road map to navigate the choices. Fortunately we were assisted by a staff member who was helpful with advice , having asked him with what we wanted. We were served an appetiser of small crotons/biscuits with a slice of cured meat and cheese, which was welcome. The bread was not special and we were not offered water? For a starter I tried the "Russian Salad", which I needed to ask at ordering what it was. The salad is heavily potato based with other vegetables, and covered in a sauce. I found it a little beyond me to complete - which the choice was my fault. Our mains were the Cod and potato stew. The flavour of the broth, which barely covered the ingredients, was good and the meal was well cooked. The cod was represented by three small battered cod morsels, and relative to the price was not a stand out. Unfortunately the service, despite seemingly a number of available staff, was not very good. Even for our relatively small luncheon we had to wait main courses, which arrived separately, for drinks and cutlery.  A highlight of the visit , whilst waiting , was an unexpected return to Australian music nostalgia with the playing of "Air Supply" songs, which did pleasantly offset the bar noise. Today the ambience, enjoyment and relative value for money was not there, as there are many other good restaurant venues.  The clear message for us is to not always rely on your hotel concierge for recommendations! However I think our concierge is still well in front on points.

Can't wait to come back on my next visit!

They have a good wine list at reasonable prices, but what really made the meal was the wonderful service, attentive and knowledgable without being overpowering. A treat!

title_review: Terrific gem right near Retiro park
review_preview: The driver taking us from the Madrid airport to our hotel opposite the beautiful Retiro Park first recommended this restaurant to us. The hotel concierge confirmed his opinion and we made reservations for the next evening. We walked in at 8:30 and it looked like...
review_full: The driver taking us from the Madrid airport to our hotel opposite the beautiful Retiro Park first recommended this restaurant to us. The hotel concierge confirmed his opinion and we made reservations for the next evening. We walked in at 8:30 and it looked like we walked into a bar. But we were escorted to the back to a very handsome dining room and were the only ones there. By 10 pm, the place was packed! Luis, the waiter, came over and in his halting English, explained their menu and his suggestions. My wife and I immediately asked about the huge tomatoes we saw at the entrance. He told us they were from Northern Spain and we ordered a plate with onions and the house vinaigrette. Delicious! The menu is varied but there were also specials. My wife ordered the grilled bass with salt and olive oil and I ordered the tuna in soy. We also ordered various vegetables as Luis told us they specialize in the freshest in the market. The dishes were brought and we each ate quietly savoring each morsel of the food; that’s how very good it was. My tuna was rare in the center and so tasty. My wife’s bass was a half side of the fish perfectly filleted. The vegetables were extraordinary, tender and delicious. We had a suggested ’07 Rioja which went perfectly with the food. We finished with a homemade cheesecake and fresh pineapple washed down with hot cappuccinos. The entire bill including tax, tip and drinks was $145. It was one of the best meals we had during our entire 2 week trip.

title_review: Very nice setting and very good quality food
review_preview: In a very nice setting, Luis Garcia de la Navarra is offering traditional Spanish cuisine, along with “tapas” in what is a new concept, something between a wine bar and a restaurant, very centrally located behind the City Hall and close to the Prado Museum....
review_full: In a very nice setting, Luis Garcia de la Navarra is offering traditional Spanish cuisine, along with “tapas” in what is a new concept, something between a wine bar and a restaurant, very centrally located behind the City Hall and close to the Prado Museum.  They serve very good quality food, though the menu is not very large. We were four friends and ordered four appetizers to share and finally each one a main course. Everything was very tasty and well presented. I ordered a stew with potatoes and monkfish, which was delicious, though a bit salty (nothing to worry about). Dessert was delicious home-made rice with milk.  They boast an extensive wine list. It’s said that they offer 700 references. We ordered a bottle of red wine San Román (Toro), which was delicious.  After lunch we ordered some booze to put an end to an enjoyable meal. All in all we paid 45€ each.

review_preview: Reading all the great reviews for this place, I really wanted to go especially as it was very near to our hotel. We booked a table and when we arrived, we were warmly greeted and shown to our table. Thereafter, the service was great even...
review_full: Reading all the great reviews for this place, I really wanted to go especially as it was very near to our hotel. We booked a table and when we arrived, we were warmly greeted and shown to our table. Thereafter, the service was great even when the place became very busy later in the evening. We went with some suggestions from the head guy (sharing plates to start with) and had some really delicious food. The croquettes were possibly the best we've ever had as were the anchovies with slices of tomato. My partner had deep fried hake and I had the most wonderfully tasty, filleted sole. Puddings were also good though not on quite the same level. This is where the review becomes a little difficult. When the bill arrived, it seemed a little high but nothing jumped out at me immediately as being wrong. Because I felt bad scrutinizing it so closely at the table, we paid and left but afterwards discovered they has charged us 16 euros for bread! Also, those lovely tomatoes and anchovies cost 24 euros which was the same price as my sole! On the menu, they were listed as 3 euros but that must have been for a single anchovy and a single slice of tomato - there were eight on our sharing plate. The bread charge was obviously a mistake but I did feel a little misinformed about the starter. Nevertheless, prior to that, we did have a lovely evening and, as other reviewers have said, the food and service are very good...maybe just check your bill more thoroughly than we did!

Our youngest has a nut allergy and even this was not a problem.  Very nice food. We had a selection of starters including clams, tomatoes with Parmesan and oil and a vegetable and ham dish, all delicious. For mains we had entrecôte, a prawn dish and squid.  For dessert we had Creme caramel , cheesecake and chocolate fondant - all good. The children ate ham croquettes followed by ham egg and chips. All food was great, lovely red wine and bread. Service was spot on, very relaxed. The place is also five star for cleanliness. Be prepared to pay a bit more but worth it. Thanks chaps!

We had a really relaxed evening, and at no point felt rushed, despite how busy the place was. The interior was very cool and the place had a great vibe. The price was medium. Would definitely recommend!

title_review: This is NOT the international El Gauch Argentine restaurant - but it's good.
review_preview: Just a few minutes walk from the center of the city, this is a good steakhouse that is ALWAYS busy. This restaurant is cheaper than the international chain, and the steaks aren't quite as good. That said I frequented this restaurant several times while I...
review_full: Just a few minutes walk from the center of the city, this is a good steakhouse that is ALWAYS busy. This restaurant is cheaper than the international chain, and the steaks aren't quite as good. That said I frequented this restaurant several times while I was in Madrid. If you're an American, don't order the fries, not only will you find them sub-par, at €5+ you'll wish you hadn't. Other than that, it's a place I would recommend.

review_preview: This vegetarian restaurant was recommended to me as being one of the best in Madrid, and I'd have to agree!There is a warm, friendly atmosphere to the place, and it is nice and relaxed, somewhere that you could spend a lot of time of...
review_full: This vegetarian restaurant was recommended to me as being one of the best in Madrid, and I'd have to agree! There is a warm, friendly atmosphere to the place, and it is nice and relaxed, somewhere that you could spend a lot of time of an evening! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, spoke perfect English to me once they realised I don't speak much Spanish, and were very helpful in recommending dishes. They gave me an English menu as well, which I definitely appreciated! Being there on my own, they sat me at the 'singles' table, so that when other singles arrived, we could all sit together and get to know each other, which I thought was a nice touch. The food itself was delicious. I had the mushroom croquettes which were simply amazing (they haunt my dreams!) and the courgette lasagna, which is cold, but none the worse for that! I also had the chocolate mousse, which I would highly recommend to everyone! But everything that came out of the kitchen looked amazing! Wine was lovely as well, of course!  I was told it was quite expensive, but in total my meal with 2 glasses of wine came to €24 including tip, which I thought to be very reasonable and a lot cheaper than the UK! The restaurant is on Calle de la Luna, close to Gran Via so it's easy enough to find. Would highly recommend to any visiting vegetarians/vegans or anyone that loves a good meal!
